summary: The Pro-Housing Act of 2025 aims to address the affordable housing shortage. It authorizes the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) to award grants and provide direct loans to eligible entities for developing and implementing housing policy plans. The bill prioritizes projects that improve housing supply, affordability, and accessibility, particularly those leveraging other funding sources or located near transit. It also directs the General Services Administration to establish a pilot program transferring unused federal property for affordable housing development. The bill includes requirements for planning, reporting, and a learning network to support these initiatives.
